message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a teacher from Cyprus. I need to provide responses to each of the 10 statements using one of the following options: "Strongly disagree", "Disagree", "Agree", "Strongly agree", or "I don't know".

Let me think through each statement from the perspective of an educator:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a positive use case that I can reasonably agree with. AI can assist with generating ideas and improving lesson plans.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is another positive capability. AI can help personalize content based on student needs.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide individualized support through various tools.

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI has potential for supporting multilingual learners and students with special needs.

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly a positive use case that many would agree with.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern/negative aspect. I should agree that this is a potential risk.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern that most educators would agree with.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known concern with AI systems.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a valid concern in educational settings.

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is a concern about the quality of pedagogical recommendations.

As a teacher from Cyprus, I should provide balanced responses that reflect both the potential benefits and concerns of AI in education. Let me structure my responses accordingly.
